amendment.description: Amendment provides that the U.S. trustee or bankruptcy administrator can only approve credit counseling agencies which satisfy standards set in regulations promulgated by the FTC and are credited by the Council of Accreditation or equivalent third-party nonprofit accrediting organization.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to require the Federal Trade Commission to set standards for the United States Trustees to use in approving credit counseling agencies, counselors, and related programs and courses of instruction.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Dooley amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.
